meanings.definition: To perform daring or showy maneuvers, especially in sports or recreational activities.
meanings.sent1: During the ski competition, he was hotdogging by doing flips and spins in the air.
meanings.sent2: The skateboarder was hotdogging in the skate park, impressing everyone with his tricks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was hotdogging around the tree, trying to impress the other animals.
meanings.sent4: She was hotdogging through the obstacle course, showing off her agility and speed.
meanings.sent5: The pilot was hotdogging in the sky, performing loops and rolls with precision.

meanings.definition: The act of showing off or seeking attention.
meanings.sent1: His constant hotdogging at the party annoyed everyone as he tried to steal the spotlight.
meanings.sent2: Her hotdogging during the presentation made it clear she loved being the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: The cat's hotdogging in front of the mirror was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The politician's hotdogging during the debate drew both praise and criticism.
meanings.sent5: The peacock's hotdogging in the zoo attracted many visitors with its vibrant display.
